excerpt: Verdant main boulevard of Merida, home to historic mansions & the Monumento a la Patria.
detail_description: P.º de Montejo is a verdant boulevard in Merida, lined with historic mansions that harken back to the city's opulent past. The area also features the Monumento a la Patria and is home to a magnificently restored hotel housed in a historic building crafted by Yucatecan artisans. This full-service hotel offers easy access to major attractions and boasts friendly, multi-lingual staff.
name: P.º de Montejo
address: Zona Paseo Montejo, Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: This stately, restored 16th century house-turned-musuem features art exhibitions & cultural events.
detail_description: Museo Casa Montejo is a beautifully restored 16th-century house that has been transformed into a museum, showcasing art exhibitions and hosting cultural events. Built in 1549 by the three Franciscos de Montejo, this stately home stands as the city's oldest and most exquisite example of colonial plateresque architecture. The intricate ornamentation of this Spanish architectural style can be admired throughout the museum.
name: Museo Casa Montejo
address: C. 63 506, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Elegant 1890s government building with an arcaded courtyard & murals on key local events & people.
detail_description: The Palacio de Gobierno del Estado de Yucatán, also known as the Government Palace, is a striking historical building located in the heart of Merida, Mexico. Constructed in 1892, it serves as the executive government offices for the state of Yucatan. The pastel green facade of this architectural gem stands out at the intersection of Calle 60 and 61.
name: Palacio de Gobierno del Estado de Yucatán
address: Calle 60 s/n X calle 61 y 59, C. 60, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Mérida, the vibrant capital of the Mexican state of Yucatán, has a rich Mayan and colonial heritage. The city’s focal point is Plaza de la Independencia, bordered by the fortresslike Mérida Cathedral and white limestone Iglesia de la Tercera Orden, both colonial-era churches built using relics from ancient Mayan temples. The Casa de Montejo, a 16th-century mansion, is a landmark of colonial plateresque architecture.
detail_description: Merida, the lively capital of Mexico's Yucatán state, is steeped in Mayan and colonial history. At its heart lies Plaza de la Independencia, home to the imposing Mérida Cathedral and the white limestone Iglesia de la Tercera Orden, both constructed using relics from ancient Mayan temples. The city also boasts Casa de Montejo, a 16th-century mansion showcasing colonial plateresque architecture.
name: Merida
address: Yucatan, Mexico

detail_description: Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of Merida by exploring its charming plazas and parks, particularly the bustling Plaza Grande. This lively central square serves as a hub for locals and visitors alike, offering a perfect spot to soak up the culture. Don't miss out on Parque La Plancha, a sprawling new park that adds to the city's allure, along with neighborhood gems like Parque de San Sebastian. Each location invites you to connect with the community and experience Merida's unique charm firsthand.
name: Plaza grande
address: Calle 54 s/n, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: 1500s cathedral with stark Renaissance architecture, partially built with stones from Mayan ruins.
detail_description: The Catedral de San Ildefonso, also known as the Merida Cathedral, is a 16th-century cathedral with Renaissance architecture. It was partially constructed using stones from Mayan ruins. The cathedral is located in the main zocalo, surrounded by well-preserved 16th-century mansions and is one of the oldest churches in Latin America.
name: Catedral de San Ildefonso
address: C. 60, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: The rotating exhibits in this lavish museum examine the region's cultural heritage.
detail_description: The Museo Regional de Antropología, Palacio Cantón is housed in a magnificent mansion from the early 20th century, showcasing the Beaux Arts style popular in Europe and Mexico during that era. The museum features rotating exhibits that delve into the region's rich cultural heritage. Once the residence of General Francisco Canton, governor of Yucatan, this eclectic architectural masterpiece boasts intricate details such as multicolored marble and elegantly finished ceilings.
name: Museo Regional de Antropología, Palacio Cantón
address: C. 43 485, Zona Paseo Montejo, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Yucatecan Serenade, an open-air dance with live music, has been held weekly since 1965 at this park.
detail_description: Parque de Santa Lucía, located in central Merida, is a vibrant hub of cultural and nightlife activities. The park hosts the Yucatecan Serenade, an open-air dance with live music that has been a weekly tradition since 1965. On Friday and Saturday nights, locals gather in the square for salsa dancing. While the area can get noisy at times, it's a great spot for those looking to immerse themselves in Merida's lively bar and cantina scene.
name: Parque de Santa Lucía
address: C. 60 476A, Parque Santa Lucia, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Museum featuring exhibits on the history of Mérida from Mayan times to the present.
detail_description: The Museum of the City of Merida is a captivating destination that offers an insightful journey through the rich history of Mérida, tracing its evolution from ancient Mayan civilization to contemporary times. Housed in a stunning former post office building just a short stroll from Plaza Grande, this museum features four exhibition halls organized chronologically. Visitors can explore fascinating photographs and artifacts that showcase the city's vibrant past.
name: Museum of the City of Merida
address: C. 56 529A, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Bustling park with shaded paths & benches, plus music & dance events & a flag-raising ceremony.
detail_description: Plaza Grande, also known as Plaza de la Independencia or Plaza Mayor, is a bustling park in the heart of Merida. It's a popular gathering spot for locals and tourists alike, offering shaded paths, benches, and regular music and dance events. The plaza is surrounded by important buildings such as the 16th-century Cathedral of San Ildefonso and the Governors Palace, which houses giant paintings depicting Yucatan's history.
name: Plaza Grande
address: C. 60 S/N, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Free museum in a former colonial palace exhibiting works by modern & contemporary Mexican artists.
detail_description: The Museo de Arte Contemporáneo Ateneo de Yucatán MACAY, housed in a former colonial palace, showcases a diverse collection of modern and contemporary Mexican art. Situated in the Plaza Grande near the Merida Cathedral, it is the sole contemporary art museum in Merida featuring works by both national and international artists.
name: Museo de Arte Contemporáneo Ateneo de Yucatán MACAY - Fernando García Ponce
address: Ex Ateneo Peninsular, C. 60 502B-altos, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: The Palacio Municipal de Mérida is a striking pink building located in Plaza Grande. It features a clocktower and beautiful archways on both floors, offering a great view of the plaza from the second floor. This historic city hall, dating back to 1542, is one of Mexico's oldest colonial buildings. Visitors can explore the interior and enjoy free access to bathrooms.
name: Merida City Hall
address: Calle 62 s/n Palacio Municipal Colonia, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: La Chaya Maya is a highly recommended and unpretentious restaurant located in the heart of the city. It offers classic Yucatecan dishes at reasonable prices, making it a favorite among tourists and culinary enthusiasts.
name: La Chaya Maya
address: C. 57 x 62-x 62, Parque Santa Lucia, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: When in Merida, a visit to Mercado Lucas De Galvéz is a must for an authentic taste of local life. Located just a few streets away from the historic center, this bustling market offers a vibrant array of spices, peppers, and fresh chicharrones. You can sample unique delicacies like cebollas negras and escabeche oriental while exploring the diverse range of products including local crafts and souvenirs.
name: Mercado Lucas De Galvéz
address: C. 65A, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Striking, modern Mayan cultural museum with many exhibits of art, handicrafts & history.
detail_description: The Mayan World Museum of Mérida is a striking and modern cultural museum that showcases a wide array of exhibits featuring art, handicrafts, and history. Opened in 2012, the museum aims to provide insight into the lifestyle of the Mayans and their enduring influence on contemporary society.
name: Mayan World Museum of Mérida
address: C. 60 299 E, Zona Industrial, Unidad Revolución, 97110 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Pasaje de La Revolución is a large covered pedestrian-only passageway located next to the cathedral in Merida. It serves as a space for rotating art displays from the nearby Merida Museum of Contemporary Art. The passageway commemorates Mexico's revolution and independence and features colored lights on the ceiling that create a captivating atmosphere, especially at night.
name: Pasaje de La Revolución
address: C. 58 508, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Mercado 60 is a lively food stall hangout located in the heart of Merida's Historic Center. With nine culinary vendors, three bars, and two stages for live music and performances, this vibrant spot offers an impressive range of cuisines including Mexican, Argentinian, Japanese, and Texas-style BBQ. Open daily from 6pm, it transforms into a lively dance party as the night progresses.
name: Mercado 60
address: C. 60 461, Parque Santa Lucia, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Dzibilchaltún is a fascinating site where Mayan and Spanish influences converge. Visitors can explore the remains of a temple and a church, offering insight into the intersection of these two cultures. Additionally, a small museum provides valuable context about the area's rich history.
name: Dzibilchaltún
address: 97302 Yucatan, Mexico

detail_description: Manjar Blanco is a charming spot located across from the Santa Ana park, offering traditional Yucatecan breakfast. Their breakfast packages include bottomless coffee, fresh-squeezed orange juice, a fruit bowl, and various main dishes like eggs with Valladolid sausage or Chaya Omelette. The restaurant has attracted attention for its traditional Yucatecan cuisine with surprising twists such as smoked pork belly panucho and queso relleno negro.
name: Manjar Blanco
address: Calle 47 496, entre 58 y 60, Zona Paseo Montejo, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Tours are offered at this restored 1902 mansion with European furniture, decor & scenic gardens.
detail_description: Quinta Montes Molina is a beautifully restored 1902 mansion located in Merida, Mexico. The mansion offers tours showcasing its European furniture, decor, and scenic gardens. Once the private residence of the Montes Molina family, it has remained remarkably intact and provides visitors with a rare opportunity to step back in time and experience the luxurious lifestyle of Merida's elite during the Porfiriato era.
name: Quinta Montes Molina
address: P.º de Montejo 469, Zona Paseo Montejo, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Mercado de Santiago is a must-visit for food enthusiasts in Merida. Taqueria La Lupita, a local favorite, offers outstanding lechon and cochinita pibil tacos, as well as the delicious tortas de relleno negro. The market also features Loncheria Mary, where you can savor the special dish Mondongo Kabic made of beef belly served with chives, habanero chili, tortillas and lime.
name: Mercado de Santiago
address: C. 57, Parque Santiago, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: In the charming town of Halacho, visitors can immerse themselves in a unique culinary experience at Taqueria La Lupita. Chef Wilson Alonzo collaborates with local cooks to revitalize traditional Mayan cuisine, guiding guests through the bustling market to select ingredients like xicama and zapote for dishes such as polcan.
name: Taqueria La Lupita
address: Mercado de Santiago, C. 57 Supermanzana Interior, Parque Santiago, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Pola Gelato Shop, located near the Santa Lucia square in Merida's Historic Center, offers a unique variety of flavors that reflect Yucatecan traditions. With between five and ten sorbets and an equal number of gelatos available daily, you can expect classic options like chocolate alongside innovative creations inspired by regional cuisine such as chocolate with chiles, flan, pineapple with chaya, or lemon with rosemary.
name: Pola Gelato Shop
address: C. 55 467D, entre 62 y 64, Parque Santa Lucia, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Laid-back eatery offering a fusion of Lebanese & Yucatecan dishes, plus a cinema & a wine bar.
detail_description: Salón Gallos is a versatile and captivating venue that offers a blend of Lebanese and Yucatecan cuisine, along with an array of entertainment options. Housed in a former mill, this hidden gem features a restaurant, wine bar, small club, art room, cinema, and lounge all centered around an inner courtyard.
name: SALÓN GALLOS
address: C. 63 459-B, Parque de la Mejorada, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Casa T´HŌ Concept House is situated in a beautifully renovated 19th-century mansion on Paseo de Montejo. The space features a stylish courtyard and offers a variety of experiences, from healthy breakfast options to pre-dinner cocktails. Visitors can explore the collection of designer boutiques, perfumeries, and art galleries showcasing Mexican talent. This multi-concept space highlights Mexico's creative scene and is housed in an architectural monument.
name: Casa T´HŌ Concept House
address: P.º de Montejo 498, Zona Paseo Montejo, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Biciruta Mérida is a popular weekly event where certain roads in the city are closed off to traffic, allowing cyclists to freely explore the area. This family-friendly biking activity takes place every Sunday morning and the first Saturday evening of every month. Participants can rent bikes for a reasonable price or use free solo bikes available at designated spots. The route passes by various neighborhoods and landmarks, including the striking Monumento a la Patria statue.
name: Biciruta Mérida
address: Remate de Paseo de Montejo, 47 por avenida, P.º de Montejo, Zona Paseo Montejo, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Los 7 Cenotes - Sales Office is a collection of natural sinkholes near Merida, once used by the Mayans for freshwater. Today, they are popular swimming spots and offer opportunities for scuba diving and cave exploration. These cenotes are formed when limestone bedrock collapses to reveal groundwater, creating clear pools that were vital water sources for the ancient Maya.
name: Oficinas, reserva al +52 9996455722/ Offices, BOOK AT +52 9996455722
address: C. 22 98-por 15 y 17, Itzimná, 97100 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Dynamic, historic Zona Paseo Montejo surrounds an elegant pedestrian avenue lined with street food vendors, chocolate shops, and colonial architecture. Early-20th-century mansion Palacio Cantón now hosts exhibits on Mayan culture while Quinta Montes Molina is a European-style estate with landscaped gardens. Traditional folk musicians play outdoors at night, and crowds fill Irish pubs, cocktail bars, and dance clubs.
detail_description: Zona Paseo Montejo is a vibrant and historic district centered around the elegant pedestrian avenue of Paseo Montejo. The area is characterized by its colonial architecture, street food vendors, and chocolate shops. Visitors can explore the Mayan culture at Palacio Cantón, housed in an early-20th-century mansion, or wander through the landscaped gardens of Quinta Montes Molina.
name: Zona Paseo Montejo
address: Centro, 97000 Merida, Yucatan, Mexico

excerpt: Hip, airy restaurant dishing up local classics, plus spirits, craft cocktails & outdoor seating.
detail_description: The Museum of Yucateca Gastronomy in Merida is not just a restaurant, but a working museum dedicated to showcasing the unique flavors and cultural heritage of Yucatecan cuisine. The museum offers an immersive experience where visitors can witness traditional Mayan cooking techniques, such as the preparation of cochinita pibil in underground ovens, while exploring exhibits that delve into the history of chocolate and chiles.
name: Museum of Yucateca Gastronomy
address: C. 62 466-x 55-y 57, Parque Santa Lucia, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Lively hangout with colorful murals offering light bites & cocktails, plus regular live music.
detail_description: La Negrita Cantina is a vibrant hangout adorned with colorful murals, offering light bites and cocktails while featuring regular live music. Located on Calle 62 in the heart of Merida, it's a popular spot for both locals and tourists to immerse themselves in the magical experience of dancing, laughter, and storytelling.
name: La Negrita Cantina
address: Calle 62 esquina, C. 49 415, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Kuuk, which translates to "sprout" in Mayan, is a culinary gem nestled in a beautifully restored Spanish Colonial mansion along Paseo de Montejo. This chic restaurant offers an exquisite dining experience that marries modern techniques with traditional Yucatecan flavors. Under the creative guidance of award-winning Chef Pedro Evia, guests can indulge in innovative dishes like cochinita pibil and esquites, all prepared using a unique Pibinal oven that captures the essence of ancient cooking methods.
name: Kuuk
address: Av Rómulo Rozo 488, Itzimná, 97100 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Opened in 1999, this modern cultural center offers a planetarium, art exhibits & film screenings.
detail_description: Located in the heart of Merida, the Olimpo Cultural Center has been promoting art, culture, and science since its opening in 1999. This modern center features a planetarium, art exhibits, film screenings, an extensive library, a movie theater, and forums for conferences and expos. Visitors can enjoy concerts and various events while keeping an eye out for upcoming exhibitions.
name: Olimpo Cultural Center
address: s/n Calle 62 x 61, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Nectar, a renowned restaurant in Merida, recently celebrated its 20th anniversary. It is known for offering an elevated dining experience and is credited with introducing the concept to the city. The restaurant's chef, Roberto Solis, emphasizes the importance of coexistence and interaction among people to achieve understanding and common ground. Nectar offers a fully elaborated menu called the New Yucatecan Cuisine, showcasing innovative Mayan-meets-modern fare.
name: Nectar
address: Av. Andrés García Lavín 334, San Antonio Cucul, 97116 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Parque Santa Lucia is a lively, palm-fringed plaza where a popular dance event called the Yucatan Serenade has been held on Thursday nights for decades. The region’s musical history is documented at nearby Center Trova Yucateca, while Fundación de Artistas shows paintings and concept pieces by local talents. There’s chic dining at gourmet-style Mexican cantinas, Italian trattorias, and Argentinian grill restaurants.
detail_description: Parque Santa Lucia is a vibrant square known for hosting the Yucatan Serenade, a popular dance event held on Thursday nights. The area also features the Center Trova Yucateca, which showcases the region's musical history, and the Fundación de Artistas, where local talents display their paintings and concept pieces. Visitors can enjoy chic dining at Mexican cantinas, Italian trattorias, and Argentinian grill restaurants in this lively district.
name: Parque Santa Lucia
address: Centro, 97000 Merida, Yucatan, Mexico

excerpt: Urban park centered on a Mayan-inspired outdoor concert space, with evening dancing & food trucks.
detail_description: Parque de las Américas is a vibrant urban oasis in Merida, celebrated for its Mayan-inspired outdoor concert space that comes alive with evening dancing and an array of food trucks. This park serves as a cultural hub, fostering connections among locals and visitors alike. With its recently restored monumental fountain and dedicated children's area, it has become a beloved gathering spot for the community, benefiting over 11,500 residents.
name: Parque de las Américas
address: Av. Colón Por calle 20 y 23, García Ginerés, 97070 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Relaxed, open plaza featuring benches, commemorative statues & manicured grounds.
detail_description: Parque de La Mejorada is a must-visit in Merida, featuring open plazas with benches, statues, and well-maintained grounds. The park houses 47 buildings used for educational and civilian purposes, including museums, theaters, and libraries. It offers pleasant pathways surrounded by lush trees, green spaces, ponds, and seating areas. Visitors can admire the large bronze sculpture honoring the Ninos Heroes de Chapultepec.
name: Parque de La Mejorada
address: C. 57, Parque de la Mejorada, Centro, 97203 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: "Mérida en Domingo" is a vibrant event that takes place in Plaza Grande from 9 am to 7 pm every Sunday. The area around the plaza is closed to traffic, and it transforms into a lively scene with live music, dancing, and pop-up restaurants. Local vendors set up their stalls, creating an open-air flea market atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy street food, shop for local wares, and immerse themselves in the cultural and artistic ambiance of the event.
name: Mérida en Domingo
address: C. 60 S/N, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Taller Maya is more than just a store; it's a part of the World Fair Trade Organization with a mission to preserve Mayan culture. By collaborating with numerous artisans from 40 communities across the Yucatan Peninsula, Taller Maya aims to keep the rich heritage alive through its unique collection of home goods and crafts.
name: TALLER MAYA
address: Calle 38 494 B-por 51 y 53, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

name: Casas Gemelas/Cámara
address: C. 58 492, Zona Paseo Montejo, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: In the vibrant city of Merida, visitors can immerse themselves in a rich cultural tapestry that includes not only natural wonders like cenotes and beaches but also an array of artistic experiences. The historic center is brimming with significant landmarks such as the Peon Contreras Theater, which hosts compelling plays and performances by the renowned Yucatan Symphony.
name: Jose Peon Contreras Theater
address: Calle 60 número 463 entre 57y 59, Calle 59, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: City square with benches, shade trees, nearby food vendors & views of a nearby historic church.
detail_description: Parque de Santa Ana is a charming city square that serves as a delightful hub in Merida, perfect for travelers seeking both relaxation and local culture. This picturesque park features inviting benches and shade trees, making it an ideal spot to unwind while enjoying views of the stunning pastel-yellow church that shares its name. Surrounding the park, you'll find the vibrant Santa Ana Mercado, where you can indulge in authentic Yucatecan street food like tacos and cochinita pibil.
name: Parque de Santa Ana
address: C. 60 y 45, Zona Paseo Montejo, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Natural limestone pool for swimming located near a popular Maya archaeological site.
detail_description: Cenote Xlacah is a stunning natural limestone pool located near the ancient Maya archaeological site of Dzibilchaltun, making it a perfect combination of history and natural beauty. This cenote is one of the largest and deepest in the Yucatan, measuring 320 feet wide and 147 feet deep. It's often referred to as the best cenote in Merida due to its proximity, being less than 45 minutes away from the city.
name: Cenote Xlacah
address: Zona Arqueológica de Dzibilchaltún Dzibilchaltún, 97305 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: SOCO Mérida is a popular bakery and café located in the heart of Merida, Mexico. It's renowned for its delectable brunch offerings, including avocado toast, yogurt with house-made granola and seasonal fruits, and buttery egg sandwiches. The establishment also offers an array of French-style pastries and artisanal breads that are perfect for take-away or enjoying on-site with freshly-brewed coffee.
name: SOCO Mérida
address: C. 51 492C, Parque Santa Lucia, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Hermana Republica is a popular spot in Merida, offering a selection of their own brews on tap and a delicious food menu. The place has been discovered accidentally by many visitors who found it to be a rare gem with amazing meat and fast, kind service. They also have keto options available, including a delicious keto brownie. The bar and outdoor garden create a great vibe, especially on Fridays when they have DJ music.
name: Hermana Republica
address: Predio Turistico No. 14714 Lote 9 Manzana 1 Xcanatún, 97302 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Manifesto Casa Tostadora Calabrese is a renowned café in Merida, known for its dedication to providing an exceptional coffee experience. They meticulously select and roast the finest beans, offering a variety of coffee styles to cater to different preferences. Additionally, the café serves a range of food options including filet americain and sandwiches. The location on Calle 18 offers outdoor seating, while their literal manifest displayed on the wall provides insights into maximizing your coffee enjoyment.
name: Manifesto Casa Tostadora Calabrese
address: Calle 59 #538 por 66 y 68, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Casual bar with a bohemian vibe, offering booze & Mexican grub, plus live music & DJ nights.
detail_description: If you're seeking a vibrant and bohemian atmosphere in Merida, Mezcaleria La Fundacion is the place to be. Situated in Centro Historico near Paseo de Montejo, this casual bar offers an extensive array of mezcal, a traditional Mexican spirit renowned for its rich flavors and cultural significance. Embracing the region's artisanal roots, the establishment prides itself on serving 100% organic agave products.
name: Mezcaleria La Fundacion
address: C. 59 509, Parque Santa Lucia, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Bodega Mercado Lucas De Galvez is a bustling and expansive market where you can immerse yourself in the local culture, sample new foods, and take in the vibrant atmosphere. The market offers an array of local eats, from watching tortilla-making to traditional regional dish cochinita pibil. Visitors can explore the market with a local chef to learn more about its traditional foods. The market is known for its fresh produce and diverse offerings at affordable prices.
name: Mercado Lucas De Galvez
address: Calle 54 521h, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Ki'Xocolatl is a charming and unique cafe that specializes in all things chocolate. The cozy and rustic decor creates a warm and inviting atmosphere, perfect for enjoying their wide range of chocolate drinks and treats. From delicious chocolate frappes to traditional hot chocolates with spices, there's something for every chocolate lover.
name: Ki'Xocolatl
address: C. 60 471-Local 5, Parque Santa Lucia, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

excerpt: Oaxacan & Yucatecan cuisine, craft beer & mezcal spotlighted in a colorful venue with a terrace.
detail_description: Apoala is a vibrant restaurant in the heart of Merida, offering a fusion of Oaxacan and Yucatecan cuisine. The venue provides a colorful and lively setting with a terrace, where guests can savor craft beer and mezcal. For those seeking an exclusive experience, the restaurant features a hidden speak-easy called Malahat, accessible through a guided journey behind a parking lot. This intimate space offers bespoke cocktails crafted before your eyes.
name: Apoala
address: C. 60 471-Local 2, entre 55, Parque Santa Lucia, Portales de Santa Lucía, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico

detail_description: Malahat is a hidden gem located behind a nondescript wooden door in Santa Lucia park in Merida. This speakeasy-style cocktail den is inspired by the Prohibition era and offers an intimate setting with dim lighting, flickering candles, and jazz music playing in the background. Expert mixologists are ready to serve up inventive craft cocktails, making it worth the challenge of finding this elusive bar.
name: Malahat
address: Centro de Mérida, C. 60 471-Local 3, Parque Santa Lucia, Centro, 97000 Mérida, Yuc., Mexico
